intro: Calectasia hispida, commonly known as the woolly calectasia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiky inflorescence. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves covered in fine, bristly hairs, giving it a textured appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to pink. Calectasia hispida is typically grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and delicate blooms.
